This is reminding me of the early 1980s when we activists were working to pass the Equal Rights Amendment, and opponents screeched that it would force women to be drafted, force women into combat positions, etc. Of course, servicewomen were already serving in often dangerous settings, and we pointed out that prohibiting them from combat positions often prevented them from moving up the ranks & achieving higher level positions. I'd argue that these women illustrate the benefit of having those opportunities to take leadership...in the military, in their communities, and, now, in running for office.
GO! Thank you for running!

While she was wounded in combat, who'd have thought she'd be attacked by local Republicans, saying she can't serve in the legislature "because she has PTSD". She has been chased off of properties because she is black. She actually has accomplished things unlike the do nothing Republidrone she is running against.
